"); echo(abs(3)); ?> Definition and Usage The abs() function returns the absolute (positive) value of a number. Syntax abs( number ); Parameter Values Parameter Description number Required. Specifies a number. If the number is of type float, the return type is also float, otherwise it is integer Technical Details Return Value: The absolute value of the number Return Type: Float / Integer PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1
